intro: Epilobium conjungens, commonly known as the yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and streambanks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers in the spring. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. The plant's botanical name reflects its historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
